Description: Sherd of Corinthian, possibly black-figured, pottery globular aryballos consisting of rim, handle, and neck; exterior: on top of rim, seven narrow and wide bands; cross-hatching on edge of rim; on handle, four short horizontal strokes between two pairs of long vertical bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 218)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 65, no. A47.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.297) (phase 3)
